## [\[Future Data\] DuckLake: Learning from Cloud Data Warehouses to Build a Robust ‚ÄúLakehouse‚Äù](https://db.cs.cmu.edu/events/future-data-ducklake-learning-from-cloud-data-warehouses-to-build-a-robust-lakehouse/)

Jordan spoke at the Carnegie Mellon Database Group about how metadata storage enables query performance and helps provide transactional semantics in modern data warehouses. He also talked about how the metadata story in popular open data formats take us several steps backwards. He sahred about how DuckLake makes metadata access work more closely to a traditional data warehouse, which solves a lot of problems

If you‚Äôre into data engineering, analytics, or just curious about the next wave of lightweight cloud data tools, you‚Äôll want to stick around for this one.

## [MotherDuck Explained: How the Next-Gen AI & Analytics Solution Fits Into Your Data Stack](https://www.artefact.com/blog/motherduck-explained-how-it-fits-into-your-data-stack-with-benchmarks/)

At Artefact, we constantly explore emerging technologies to separate real innovation from passing hype. In today‚Äôs crowded data landscape, spotting the hidden gems that can truly make a difference is both a challenge and a thrill. MotherDuck is one of those promising technologies. When its arrival on the European market was announced at Big Data London and our partnership as of September 24th, we knew what we had to do: put it to the test, evaluate its potential, and share our insights.

[![Your First Data Analysis with MotherDuck and DuckDB: From CSV to Insights in 5 Minutes](https://motherduck.com/_next/image/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmotherduck-com-web-prod.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fassets%2Fimg%2Fcodecentric_blog_9_25_04c8bbdb43.png&w=3840&q=75)](https://www.codecentric.de/en/knowledge-hub/blog/your-first-data-analysis-with-duckdb-from-csv-to-insights-in-5-minutes)

[2025/09/30 - Codecentric](https://www.codecentric.de/en/knowledge-hub/blog/your-first-data-analysis-with-duckdb-from-csv-to-insights-in-5-minutes)

## [Your First Data Analysis with MotherDuck and DuckDB: From CSV to Insights in 5 Minutes](https://www.codecentric.de/en/knowledge-hub/blog/your-first-data-analysis-with-duckdb-from-csv-to-insights-in-5-minutes)

In this post, we'll explore how MotherDuck, powered by DuckDB, revolutionizes the way you interact with your data, particularly when dealing with CSV files. You'll learn how to quickly parse and filter even large datasets directly from your local machine, using familiar SQL syntax, and without the need for a dedicated server or extensive configuration. Get ready to transform your raw CSV data into valuable insights in a matter of minutes!

## [Honest review of MotherDuck](https://dataengineeringcentral.substack.com/p/honest-review-of-motherduck)

...the MotherDuck signup flow is incredible.

It‚Äôs a beautiful UI, step by step, snappy. Everything you would expect from something built in this century, and bodes well for the things we have yet to do.

One of the first things you will notice is the nice clean layout, one that doesn‚Äôt leave you wondering where to click next or what to explore.

## [DuckDB benchmarked against Spark](https://blog.dataexpert.io/p/duckdb-can-be-100x-faster-than-spark)

Instead of guessing whether Spark or DuckDB is faster, we built out some tests datasets with increasing number of rows and then time query benchmarks between both DuckDB and Spark to illustrate just how fast DuckDB is

## [Introducing the Stacksync connector for MotherDuck](https://www.stacksync.com/blog/introducing-the-motherduck-connector)

Data workflows can get messy with constant back-and-forth between local analytics and cloud solutions. But what if you could have the best of both worlds: lightweight, in-process analytics and scalable cloud power?

That's where Stacksync's new MotherDuck connector comes in, so you can quit ducking around with complex setups.

## [It Depends Podcast: Jordan Tigani on how DuckDB and MotherDuck power Small Data](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tip96F_u8lc)

Jordan Tigani shares why he chose DuckDB as the foundation for MotherDuck. As a founding member of Google‚Äôs BigQuery, Jordan‚Äôs transition from Big Data to Small Data is particularly fascinating. It's quite the plot twist!

Jordan takes us on a geeky joyride through the database's internals and its unique differentiators. Beyond the technical deep dive, we also explore the intriguing backstory behind the quirky name, MotherDuck.

[![PR Newswire: MotherDuck Announces General Availability](https://motherduck.com/_next/image/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmotherduck-com-web-prod.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fassets%2Fimg%2Fmotherduck_goes_ga_160f03c1bb.jpg&w=3840&q=75)](https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/motherduck-announces-general-availability-brings-simplicity-and-power-of-duckdb-in-a-serverless-data-warehouse-302168749.html)

[2024/06/11 - MotherDuck](https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/motherduck-announces-general-availability-brings-simplicity-and-power-of-duckdb-in-a-serverless-data-warehouse-302168749.html)

## [PR Newswire: MotherDuck Announces General Availability](https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/motherduck-announces-general-availability-brings-simplicity-and-power-of-duckdb-in-a-serverless-data-warehouse-302168749.html)

MotherDuck, builder of a serverless, easy to use data analytics platform based on open source database DuckDB, today announced the general availability of MotherDuck, providing the 99% of users who do not need a complex data infrastructure with the ability to use DuckDB's simplicity at scale. DuckDB 1.0, which was recently announced by DuckDB Foundation and Labs, provides a scale-up approach to analytics that is faster, cheaper and more user-friendly than distributed architectures.

## [Data App Monetization Success](https://drive.google.com/file/d/14m-P2-6ho8o3dXCHxxmsrBbXl-kwGZD9/view?usp=sharing)

Explore how to use Astrodata, MotherDuck, and Cube‚Äôs combined data stack to build embedded analytics. The speakers in this webinar underscored the importance of several key characteristics for successful data monetization strategies: analytics, monetary value, user convenience, interactivity, and real-time capabilities. The presentation of the MDCuRe stack with MotherDuck, Cube, and React illustrated how developers stand to benefit from reduced unit costs and better ease of use.

[![Building Local and Serverless ELT(ETL) pipelines with CloudQuery and MotherDuck](https://motherduck.com/_next/image/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmotherduck-com-web-prod.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fassets%2Fimg%2Fcloudquery_blog_8c6cef78fe.webp&w=3840&q=75)](https://www.cloudquery.io/blog/building-local-and-serverless-elt-cq-and-md)

[2024/03/19 - Yevgeny @ CloudQuery](https://www.cloudquery.io/blog/building-local-and-serverless-elt-cq-and-md)

## [Building Local and Serverless ELT(ETL) pipelines with CloudQuery and MotherDuck](https://www.cloudquery.io/blog/building-local-and-serverless-elt-cq-and-md)

In this blog post we will walk through building an ELT pipeline using CloudQuery and DuckDB locally and then how to run the same configuration and pipeline with CloudQuery Cloud and MotherDuck (DuckDB Cloud version).

One cool thing about CloudQuery and DuckDB is that both of them are very easy to run locally which makes it easy to develop and debug before running in the cloud which can save time on feedback loops and surging cloud costs of compute, data, and egress - especially for development purposes.
